definition: pawn (i.e. foot soldier)/servant/lackey (of malefactor)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
soldier/servant/to finish/to die/finally/at last/pawn in Chinese chess
variant of 卒[zu2]
variant of 猝[cu4]
lit. peddlers and carriers/common people/lower class

sentences.english: He became a faithful restoration dynasty pawns .
sentences.chinese: 他成了复辟王朝的忠实走卒。

sentences.english: The member is now a 'foot soldier'.
sentences.chinese: 这名成员现在是一名“走卒”。

sentences.english: His disciples were fishermen and common people.
sentences.chinese: 他的门徒都是一些渔夫和贩夫走卒。

sentences.english: And did you exchange a walk-on part in the war for a lead role in a cage?
sentences.chinese: 你是否拿战争中的行兵走卒换成笼子里的主角？

definition: peddler/street vendor
lit. peddlers and carriers/common people/lower class
merchant
common people
poor people (idiom)/those who live from hand to mouth
high official and noble persons (idiom); the great and the good

the Three Religions (Daoism, Confucianism, Buddhism) and Nine Schools (Confucians, Daoists, Yin-Yang, Legalists, Logicians, Mohists, Political Strategists, Eclectics, Agriculturists)/fig. people from all trades (often derog.)
tycoon/magnate
marketplace/town/the street (urban milieu)/the haunts of the common people
to hang on to and serve the rich and powerful by literary hack work etc
ordinary people/the hoi polloi/commoner
the multitude of common people (in highbrow literature)/plebeian
porter/bearer
"the four classes" of ancient China, i.e. scholars, farmers, artisans, and merchants
the lowest professions
foot soldier/minor figure/a nobody/(chess) pawn
